page.title: 15SPENNITHORNE AREA - RELIGION
page.content: THERE IS ONE METHODIST CHAPEL IN HARMBY AND AN ANGLICAN CHURCH IN SPENNITHORNE.THERE ARE USUALLY ONLY ABOUT TWENTY IN EACH CONGREGATION. THERE IS A SUNDAY SCHOOL AND A MOTHERS UNION RUN BY THE CHURCH.THERE IS A SHOW IN HARMBY WHERE PEOPLE SHOW OFF THEIR SKILLS.THERE IS AN ANNUAL SPORTS DAY IN HARMBY WHERE THERE ARE STALLS AND RACES.AT HARMBY THERE IS ALSO A GALA HELD AT ROBINS GARTH.THE MONEY THAT IS RAISED GOES TO CHARITY.IT IS ALSO A CUSTOM FOR SPENNITHORNE SCHOOL PUPILS TO PUT A CHRISTMAS CONCERT ON FOR THE VILLAGE PEOPLE. IT IS SAID THAT THERE ARE TWO GHOSTS IN THIS AREA.PARSON'S BARN IS SUPPOSED TO BE HAUNTED BY A MURDERED MAN.BEHIND THE RECTORY THERE IS SAID TO BE THE GHOST OF A HUNTERS DOG. PEOPLE HAVE THE SAME SUPERSTITIONS AS THE REST OF THE COUNTRY REGARDING LUCK
